title: Transfer news: Tottenham re-sign Michel Vorm as cover for injured Hugo Lloris
text:
Tottenham have brought back Michel Vorm just three-and-a-half months after releasing the goalkeeper on a free transfer at the end of last season.

Spurs are desperate for cover in between the sticks with Hugo Lloris not expected to return until the new year after suffering a dislocated elbow in defeat at Brighton earlier this month.

Lloris will not require surgery on the injury, but the club captain has sustained ligament damage and isn't expected to return to training until January.

Tottenham have brought back Michel Vorm to the club as cover for the injured Hugo Lloris

The Dutch international had left the club in the summer after his contract expired

With Paulo Gazzaniga the only fit senior gloveman on the books, Vorm's return adds some much-needed depth.

He has signed until the end of the season.

Lloris' injury was confirmed by France manager Didier Deschamps last week.

With three minutes played at the Amex Stadium, the Frenchman attempted to claim Pascal Gross' cross but fumbled it and fell into his goalmouth.

As Lloris clutched his arm in agony, Neal Maupay tapped in the Seagulls' first in a 3-0 defeat that increased the pressure on manager Mauricio Pochettino.

Tottenham keeper Hugo Lloris dislocated his elbow as Neal Maupay scored for Brighton
